alert.note: Alert for Carter; Johnston; Love; Marshall (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 30 at 1:55AM CDT until March 30 at 2:45AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Johnston County in southeastern Oklahoma... Love County in southern Oklahoma... Southeastern Carter County in southern Oklahoma... Northwestern Marshall County in southeastern Oklahoma... * Until 245 AM CDT. * At 155 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 5 miles southwest of Marietta, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Ardmore, Madill, Marietta, Dickson, Mannsville, Thackerville, Gene Autry, Overbrook, Lake Murray, Burneyville, Lebanon, Russett, western Lake Texoma and Oakland. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
